snippet: A rebel stronghold convulsed with some of the heaviest fighting in months, as activists debated how the United States’ decision to send arms would affect their fight to topple the Syrian president.
abstract: Syrian forces renew attack on Aleppo as rebels weigh United States vow to provide them with weapons.

byline.contributor: Hania Mourtada contributed reporting from Beirut, Lebanon, and an employee of The New York Times from Aleppo, Syria.

lead_paragraph: A rebel stronghold convulsed with some of the heaviest fighting in months, as activists debated how the United States’ decision to send arms would affect their fight to topple the Syrian president.

headline.main: Aleppo Pounded, Rebels Weigh U.S. Vow of Aid
headline.print_headline: Aleppo Pounded, Rebels Weigh U.S. Vow of Aid
